CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Art. 3 (in case of deportation to Iran);Violation of Art. 5-1;Violation of Art. 5-4;No violation of Art. 3 (substantive aspect);Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and is currently held in the ORG Admission and ORG , in GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant first entered GPE on DATE using a false passport . She began living and working in GPE without informing the NORP authorities or the ORG High Commissioner for Refugees ( “ the ORG ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied to the ORG and asked to be recognised as a refugee . On an unspecified date in DATE she was detained by the NORP authorities and deported to GPE , where she claims to have been imprisoned for DATE and subjected to illtreatment .
CARDINAL . Following her release from prison in GPE , the applicant reentered GPE illegally on DATE . She learned that her case before the ORG had been closed in her absence .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant was diagnosed with myomatosis of the uterus and operated in a private hospital on DATE . The medical reports , in particular the pathology results , revealed that there were no cancerous cells .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , she became interested in NORP and began attending Bible classes . On DATE the applicant was baptised in a NORP church in GPE . On an unspecified date the applicant 's son , who was attending ORG in GPE , was expelled on the ground of “ conduct against the school 's faith ” . Some time within DATE of that incident the applicant applied to ORG in GPE for a passport . While there , she was asked to complete a form stating that she was a NORP .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date at DATE , the applicant applied to the ORG and requested that her case be re - examined .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant went to the LOC police headquarters in GPE in order to make statements as a witness regarding a criminal offence committed by third persons . As she was found to have identity documents with different names on them , an investigation was initiated into this and she was arrested . On an unspecified date she was released .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was rearrested on suspicion of infringement of visa requirements and forging official documents . According to a letter sent by the GPE police to the GPE responsible for foreigners , borders and asylum attached to ORG on DATE , the applicant had stated that she did not wish to live in GPE and that she had come to GPE in order to apply to the ORG . The same letter stated that the applicant had been placed in ORG of the GPE police headquarters with a view to her deportation from GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the director of the department responsible for foreigners , borders and asylum attached to the ORG requested the GPE police headquarters to obtain statements from the applicant regarding a number of issues , including her failure to apply to the NORP authorities when she had applied to the ORG , the reason why she had made multiple entries and exits between GPE and GPE and why she was staying illegally in GPE . The director also requested that the possible security risks that the applicant may pose in GPE be determined .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant sent another letter to ORG . Referring to her medical condition , she requested urgent treatment and asked to be released and issued with a temporary residence permit pending the proceedings before the ORG and the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was questioned by a police officer at the GPE police headquarters . She maintained , inter alia , that she had initially entered GPE with a false passport and that she had been deported to GPE where she had spent DATE in prison . She contended that when she re - entered NORP territory on DATE she had immediately re - applied to the ORG . She noted that she was against the present government in GPE and that she and her family members had been oppressed when they lived in GPE . The applicant mentioned that she had left and reentered NORP territory as that was the only way to renew her visa . She further contended that she had not applied to the NORP authorities earlier as her case had been closed by the ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's statements were sent to ORG by the GPE police .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE and DATE , the applicant 's representative lodged petitions with ORG and requested that his client be released and given a residence permit pending the outcome of her application to the ORG .

CARDINAL . By a letter dated DATE , the deputy director of the GPE police headquarters informed the GPE police headquarters that the applicant did not wish to return to her country , but wished to seek asylum , and had applied to ORG . The director reiterated that she had been held in the GPE police headquarters with a view to her deportation . He further maintained that the applicant should be held in the GPE Foreigners ' Admission and ORG pending the outcome of the proceedings before the ORG . On DATE the applicant was transferred to that facility .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that her case before the NORP authorities was suspended pending the proceedings before the ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and her son were recognised as refugees , under the ORG 's mandate , on religious grounds .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's representative lodged a case with ORG . He requested the court to annul the decision of the Ministry not to release his client and to order a stay of execution of that decision pending the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's request for a stay of execution .
CARDINAL . The applicant 's representative appealed . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal .

CARDINAL . In his submissions to the ORG dated DATE the applicant 's representative contended that , although the applicant was suffering from serious consequences of the operation she underwent in DATE , she did not have access to a doctor in the Kırklareli Foreigners ' Admission and ORG . On DATE he informed the ORG that the applicant had been examined by a doctor , who had ordered a further medical examination . Despite this , ORG did not authorise a further examination and the applicant 's health was deteriorating .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , with CARDINAL other persons , started a “ fast to the death ” to protest about her placement and the physical conditions in the LOC .

CARDINAL . Before the ORG , the applicant maintained that the physical conditions in the ORG were below the minimum standards set by ORG for the Prevention of Torture ( the “ CPT ” ) . In support of her submissions the applicant provided a number of photographs containing images of several parts of the Centre . In CARDINAL room there were CARDINAL bunk beds on which there were pillows and blankets . There was no bed linen on the beds . In another room there were QUANTITY beds with bed linen , pillows and blankets . The photographs of the kitchen sinks and stoves showed that the latter were unusable . Another photograph showed that there were CARDINAL sinks in the bathroom . Inside , the toilets were partially covered with some kind of dark substance . Photographs of the cleaning products that had labels in the LANGUAGE alphabet showed that their dates had expired DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicant finally alleged that the officers who worked at the ORG did not treat the detainees well . In particular , she had been insulted and threatened by a police officer .

CARDINAL . The Government replied that the applicant was subjected to a series of medical examinations during DATE at ORG According to the documents submitted , blood tests , an abdomino - pelvic ultrasound examination and an abdominal tomography were performed on the applicant . The doctors found no pathological signs as a result of these examinations .

CARDINAL . The Government denied the applicant 's allegation that the physical conditions at the Kırklareli Foreigners ' Admission and ORG did not comply with the minimum standards established by the ORG . Noting that the ORG in question was not a detention facility , the Government provided photographs of a birthday party and an engagement party , both organised in the common room of the FAC . They further submitted photographs of an NORP celebration ( Festival of PERSON ) organised in the garden of the ORG .

CARDINAL . In their submissions dated DATE , the ORG maintained that an investigation had been initiated into the actions of the police officer who had allegedly insulted the applicant in relation to the latter 's complaint of ill - treatment .
CARDINAL . A description of the relevant domestic law and practice may be found in the case of GPE and GPE v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE ) .

CARDINAL . The standards of ORG for the Prevention of Torture and Inhuman or Degrading Treatment or Punishment concerning the conditions of detention of foreign nationals ( see the ORG standards , document no . ORG ( DATE ) CARDINAL- Rev. CARDINAL , page CARDINAL ) provide , in so far as relevant , as follows :

“ ... In the view of the ORG ... where it is deemed necessary to deprive persons of their liberty for an extended period under aliens ' legislation , they should be accommodated in centres specifically designed for that purpose ...

Obviously , such centres should provide accommodation which is adequatelyfurnished , clean and in a good state of repair , and which offers sufficient living space for the numbers involved . Further , care should be taken in the design and layout of the premises to avoid as far as possible any impression of a carceral environment . As regards regime activities , they should include outdoor exercise , access to a day room and to radio / television and newspapers / magazines , as well as other appropriate means of recreation ( e.g. board games , table tennis ) . The longer the period for which persons are detained , the more developed should be the activities which are offered to them . ... ”

CARDINAL . In DATE ORG visited CARDINAL ORG in GPE , including the FAC in GPE . The relevant extracts from the report entitled “ Stuck in a Revolving Door ” , published by ORG on DATE , read as follows :

“ ... ORG ( hereafter PERSON ) has had a long history as an actual refugee camp . In DATE it was a safe haven for ethnic NORP fleeing GPE ; in DATE , a shelter for refugees from GPE ; and in DATE , a place of refuge for NORP . It can no longer be described , truthfully , as a refugee camp , however . It is rather a detention centre for migrants , some of whom may indeed be refugees , but not refugees being protected from persecution , but rather refugees that GPE is seeking to remove .
At the time of ORG visit , GPE held CARDINAL detainees , including CARDINAL women and the DATE child of CARDINAL of the women .

Although the men are locked away in a long barracks building , they were freely wandering around the outdoor grounds of the fenced - in facility during the ORG visit . They appeared to be allowed to go outside the barracks during the afternoons . The facility is surrounded by a chain - link fence topped with barbed wire . Signs of its history as a former refugee camp are abundant in the form of old unused shelters with faded ORG logos and an overgrown soccer field that have not been used in DATE , despite a rather comical attempt by the ORG administrator to give Human Rights a guided tour intended to show that old classrooms and recreational facilities are still being used by the detainees .

The women and child were housed in a separate building that the women told ORG they had recently been asked to clean prior to a visit by another delegation . The administrator showed ORG a large - screen television set in CARDINAL of the women 's private rooms , but failed to note that the TV was not plugged in and did n't work at all . Although the men are allowed to leave their barracks during most TIME , the guards tell the women that they are not allowed to leave their building . " The door is kept open to allow the child to come and go , but we are not allowed to walk out the door , " said a DATE NORP woman .

Both men and women at ORG complained about the poor quality and small quantity of food . A man claiming to be NORP said , " The food is not good . It is not fit for humans , and it is not enough . Nothing happens if we complain . The guards say , ' If you do n't like the food , go to the market and buy your own . ' "

The main complaint , however , is that the detainees are not informed how long they will remain in detention . ORG spoke privately with a man who appeared to be an informal leader of the " NORP " at GPE . He said that the NORP numbered CARDINAL of the CARDINAL detainees in the camp and that most , including him , had already been held there for DATE and had no idea how much longer they would stay there . " Just tell us what to do , " he said . " Give us a sentence . If they let us leave , we will work and feed our families . Let us leave or kill us . ”

Even though the conditions at GPE did not appear to be nearly as bad as at PERSON , tensions between detainees and guards were very high . The camp administrator told ORG , " Despite the good conditions here , there is an enmity towards us . "

On TIME after ORG visit there was a riot at GPE . The causes of the riot and the response of the security forces were under investigation when ORG left the country . In the course of putting down the disturbance , NORP security forces shot and killed one of the detainees , a young man of unknown nationality who ORG had talked to at length . ... ”

CARDINAL . On DATE around midnight a riot started in the Kırklareli Foreigners ' Admission and ORG . During the riot an asylum seeker died and another asylum seeker and CARDINAL police officers were wounded . Subsequent to the riot , ORG ) , a human rights organisation based in GPE , made a visit to the FAC in order to assess the situation there . During this visit , FAC interviewed persons held in the FAC , the GPE governor , the director of the ORG and CARDINAL of the officers who had been injured . The governor stated , inter alia , that the authorities were doing their best to meet the needs of the persons held in the FAC . The director also stated that they maintained good standards of living in the LOC .

CARDINAL . Following the initiation of the “ fast to the death ” by the CARDINAL persons held in the Kırklareli Foreigners ' Admission and Accommodation Centre , including the applicant , on DATE ORG made a second visit to the ORG in order to interview the persons on hunger strike and to observe the living conditions in the FAC . According to the report published by ORG , they were not allowed to visit the inside of the LOC where foreign nationals were held . They could however interview the applicant and CARDINAL persons , who maintained that there had been problems regarding the quality of food provided by the administration of ORG , the ORG 's hygiene , access to medical care and common living space .
